source_sentence: 南無大慈大悲救苦觀世音。
translation: Homage to Avalokitêśvara, the voice of great kindness and great compassion that saves lives from suffering.
Please let the holy hand touch my head.
Save and protect those in the sahā world who commit heavy crimes.
Settle down in the land of nirvāṇa and liberation.
Each time I make offerings to the buddhas.
He liberates them all like a shadow following his form.
May I always accept and maintain them so that I don't part with them.

source_sentence: 西方阿彌陀佛觀世音菩薩得大勢至菩薩有能。
translation: Amitâbha Buddha of the West, Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva, and Mahāsthāmaprāpta Bodhisattva are capable of doing so.
Those who recite the names of these one Buddha and two bodhisattvas will be freed from the suffering of birth-and-death and never enter hell.
He'll escape the suffering of birth-and-death and never enter hell.
He'll always meet the good consciousnesses.
Those who have doubts and difficulties.

source_sentence: 誦此經一千遍即得解脫。
translation: Recite this sūtra a thousand times and you'll be liberated.

source_sentence: 一願三寶恒存立　二願風雨順時行　三願國王壽萬歲　四願邊地無刀丘　五願三塗離苦難　六願百病盡消除　七願眾生行慈孝　八願屠人莫殺生　九願牢囚所得脫　十願法界普安寧　眼願莫見刀光刃　耳願不聞怨殃聲　口願不用為心語　手願不殺一眾生　總願當來值彌勒　連辟相將入化城。
translation: 1. may the Three Treasures always remain standing 2. may the wind and rain travel with the seasons 3. may the king live ten thousand years 4. may there be no knife-throwers in the borderlands 5. may the three destinies escape suffering 6. may all illnesses be eliminated 7. may sentient beings practice kindness and filial piety 8. may butchers not kill sentient beings 9. may prisoners be freed 10. may the Dharma realm be completely tranquil Eyes may not see the blades of swords Ears may not hear the sound of resentments Mouth may not speak for the sake of the mind Hand may not kill a single sentient being Vow that in the future he'll meet Maitreya Even the Vairocana will enter the city of transformation.
